Gainesville ISD has launched a COVID-19 dashboard to provide our families and staff with a transparent and up-to-date snapshot of lab-confirmed positive cases of COVID-19 in our district.

An active case indicates that a student or staff member has received a lab-confirmed positive case of COVID-19 and they have not yet returned to campus. Individuals who test positive are excluded from participation in any in-person/on-campus activity until the campus verifies that the individual meets the return criteria set by state and local health authorities. Once the individual is cleared to return, they are then considered a recovered case.

Students and staff labeled as quarantined are a result of either a personal lab-confirmed positive case OR exposure to a lab-confirmed positive case. Exposures are reported to GISD by a parent and/or the Cooke County Emergency Management System as a result of contact tracing.

This data will be updated each school day. The dashboard is located on the district and campus websites under news & announcements.

https://www.gainesvilleisd.org/gainesvilleisd

The transportation department is processing the requests and bus routes as quick as possible.

Please remember that 50% capacity (26 riders) on buses, with the limitations of the same number of buses and drivers as in previous years, means bus routes have to be doubled which takes longer than usual. Emails are sent to the parent contact listed for each student in parent portal. This is linked to the student information system. If you need to update and email address, please do so for EACH student on your parent portal account. This is different than the email shown in your account settings. Once the campus registrar approves the change it will go into effect.

Parents of new GISD students: Your emails and contact info are not yet accessible for the emails and phone calls. We are working with campus registrars to get this information by the end of the week, next week at the latest, so that you will receive the same communication regarding reopening.

An email with a commitment form will be emailed on Thursday and will be open until July 31st. This gives every parent a choice of instruction (in-person or virtual) for each of their students.

All information is posted to our website: www.gainesvilleisd.org/returntolearn

Please give her a huge round of applause and drop some good luck vibes below! We are so proud of our Leopard!

Gainesville ISD will continue to provide free grab-and-go meals for children through July 31. Any child 18 and under may receive two meals daily (breakfast and lunch), and do not have to be enrolled in GISD schools to receive free meals. Due to federal guidelines, dinner will no longer be served.

Beginning July 1, Chalmers Elementary, located at 600 S FM 3092, will be the sole location to pick up meals. Meals are available for pick up Monday through Thursday, and weekend meals may also be picked up on Thursday.

To pick up student meals, please drive through the back (east) side of the building. Meals will be available for pick up from 8am-12pm.

Student meal services update!

The Texas Department of Agriculture has instructed school districts to discontinue serving weekend meals. Beginning today, March 30, meal services will also include snacks.

During the school district closure, GISD is providing free grab-and-go student meals. Any child 18 and under has the option to receive 3 meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) and 1 snack per day. However, effective immediately, if a student is not in attendance then the parent needs to provide documentation (student ISD, birth cert, report card, etc) for each child.

Meals may be picked up Monday-Friday from 8am-1pm from either Edison Elementary or Gainesville Junior High.

UPDATE: The test results are in and the parent tested NEGATIVE for the coronavirus.

At approximately 12:30pm today, March 12, a GISD parent self-reported symptoms which mirror the coronavirus. The parent has been tested by a medical professional but a positive diagnosis has NOT been confirmed. The parent has a student at Edison Elementary. The student of the parent was immediately removed from the classroom and picked up by a family member.

On January 22nd, GISD students in 2nd-8th grade participated in the 9th annual GISD District Spelling Bee. All 14 of these students first competed at their individual campus spelling bees, which were part of the Scripps National Spelling Bee contest. The highest performing students from each grade level/campus were invited to compete at the District Bee.

Although the District Bee does not determine advancement in the Scripps Bee, it gives GISD an opportunity to recognize the top spellers at each campus and practice at the next level. The Bee Champion was Amira Khan, 7th grade student at Gainesville Junior High. Also finishing in the top 3 were Avery Crutsinger, 2nd place, and Jackson Otts, 3rd place.

We appreciate the hard work of Ms. Sims, Mr. Whitson, the cast and crew, and last but not least the parents who dedicated their time to this production!

Gainesville High School Theatre Troupe #7988
November 19, 2019 at 4:18 AM ·

The company of Matilda would like to thank each and everyone who came out to support our show! Thank you all for filling the audience and our hearts. It was so wonderful sharing this story with all of you! "Even if you're little you can do a lot, you mustn't let a little thing like little stop you!"

Production photos will be up in the next day or so!

post_text: Mr. Joe Grotte, W.E. Chalmers Elementary custodian, is the GISD Employee of the Month! To say Mr. Joe is one-of-a-kind is an understatement. Anyone who sees Mr. Joe sees his positive attitude, helpfulness, friendly nature, and can see that he is someone who truly loves his job! Mr. Joe has been loved by the students and staff at Chalmers for the past seven years, and loved by the Gainesville community for a lifetime! Joe is a graduate of GISD, as well as his three children, and was happy to come back for his second career at Chalmers. Thank you Mr. Joe for taking such good care of the Chalmers building, students, and staff!

post_text: Congratulations to Mrs. Ashley Dill, our GISD Elementary Teacher of the Month! Ashley has been teaching for 17 years, and has served in several vital roles in her 4 years at GISD. Regardless of what age level and in which capacity, one thing is certain, Ashley is passionate about her students and dedicated to encouraging a love of reading in ALL students. Currently, Ashley is the Reading Interventionist at Edison Elementary and is helping these young readers make big strides in their literacy! Not only is she helping the students directly in small group, she is sharing her knowledge of guided reading with teachers so that they can be equipped for success in their own classroom reading instruction. Thank you Ashley for the impact that you are making on our district!
